Steven Colbert Roasts Rachel Maddow in Parody 
“Ignoring me because I’m wearing the hat is ridiculous,” the accountant replied. “It’s really sad.” 
The reportedly “flustered” bartender then served their second round of drinks, though he also “slammed the drinks down” as he did so, according to Piatek. 
As if that weren’t bad enough, the Philadelphia man was then hassled by another bartender for being a “terrible” person and told by a third bartender not to dare to order a drink from her.   
Charming people, huh? But at least they tolerated his presence, whereas the bar’s owner, Jon Neidlich, was so stunningly intolerant that he reportedly demanded the trio leave the bar immediately. 
“Anyone who supports Trump or believes what you believe is not welcome here,” he reportedly told the on-duty manager to tell Piatek and his pals. “And you need to leave right now because we won’t serve you!” 
Piatek has since sued the bar. The details of the suit were not immediately known. 
As noted by The Washington Times , anti-MAGA-hat bigotry (which, apparently, is a real thing, courtesy of liberal intolerance) runs pretty darn deep.
